wikitext.*:
'''Haranyë''' is a calendar term used in the context of the [[King's Reckoning]]. It is probably the name of the last year of a century.<ref name=D2>{{App|D2}}</ref>
==Etymology==
{{quote|In every fourth year, except the last of a century (''haranyë'')...|[[J.R.R. Tolkien]]<ref name=D2/>}}
The word is obviously [[Quenya]], but of uncertain etymology.

[[Helge Fauskanger]] notes that Tolkien's wording does not make clear whether the word describes the "last [year] of a century" or a translation of "century" itself.<ref>{{webcite|author=[[Helge Fauskanger]]|website=Arda|articleurl=http://folk.uib.no/hnohf/quen-eng.htm|articlename=Quettaparma Quenyallo}}</ref>

The word's [http://eldamo.org/content/words/word-2462020639.html entry] at ''[[Eldamo]]'' glosses it as "century".
